entries.question: What is MusicSketch?
entries.answer: The Sketch Music App is designed to help songwriters and musicians at all levels capture music ideas on their mobile devices. We aspire to deliver a product that will make it simple for artists to create and refine their music, and then share those ideas as a lead-sheet. We are committed to supporting a collaborative experience at many levels; the first release provides the ability to easily share song files so multiple people can work together on a music idea. Our innovative Direct Interface BOard (DIBO) allows for quick and easy note entry, and our UI adapts additional notation elements. While our platform doesn’t capture the entire functionality of desktop music publishing software, we think the tradeoff for speed, simplicity, and accessibility is more than worth it. We appreciate and welcome input from all of our users.  New capabilities are in the works, but we will continue to make trade-offs to ensure that the MusicSketch App remains uncluttered and easy to use, allowing musicians at all levels to focus on their creative ideas.

entries.question: What is the focus of MusicSketch?
entries.answer: We are particularly interested in helping songwriters and musicians at all levels capture and refine their music ideas on their mobile devices.

entries.question: How do I use MusicSketch to design music?
entries.answer: We designed MusicSketch to make it easy to iterate on your music ideas, measure by measure.  By using the DIBO or Keyboard, you can alter measures in either stave, listen to your idea, and quickly make changes.

entries.question: Is MusicSketch helpful for creating a lead sheet?
entries.answer: We created MusicSketch specifically for musicians who want to capture music ideas on their iPhone, share these ideas with other musicians, and publish their songs as a high-quality lead sheet.

entries.question: How do I collaborate with other musicians?
entries.answer: Today you can collaborate with other musicians by sharing a song from your library in the MusicSketch format. When another musician downloads the App, they can listen to your music, view your notation, and immediately make changes to their copy of your song. Imagine changing a lead sheet at a gig, making a quick change, and sharing with your bandmates in seconds!

entries.question: What is the business model for MusicSketch?
entries.answer: The Music Sketch App at launch is free for the first year and then converts to a low cost subscription model.

entries.question: Are my songs accessible by others?
entries.answer: Your songs reside on your iPhone or your iCloud account and are not accessible by others unless you explicitly share them.

entries.question: App Privacy information?
entries.answer: MusicSketch does not collect any user information.

entries.question: What is the DIBO?
entries.answer: The DIBO is our unique and patent pending Direct Interface BOard that we developed to make it easy and fast to enter music notation. The circular buttons on the DIBO map directly to the staff in either clef. The DIBO currently supports 25 notes in either staff plus the flats and sharps. This range was selected because it covers almost all music found in lead sheets while keeping the interface simple.

entries.question: What does the rabbit button do?
entries.answer: The rabbit button activates a mode that immediately advances the staff cursor after a single note is entered.

entries.question: What limits to notation are there in the app?
entries.answer: The MusicSketch App is focused on developing music ideas on the go and creating lead sheets.  While we support composition in two staves, the G and F clefs, and while you can input complex sheet music, we do not plan today to support several notations in piano sheet music such as dynamics and sustain.

entries.question: How do I share a song?
entries.answer: Swipe the cell to the right in the song-list view or tap the share button on the toolbar in the multi-measure view

entries.question: What export formats are supported?
entries.answer: M4A Audio, PDF, MIDI, and MusicXML

entries.question: How do I delete a song?
entries.answer: Swipe a cell in the Song List to the left, then tap the Trash Button.

entries.question: How can I recover a song that's been deleted?
entries.answer: Tap the trash icon at the bottom of the song list then tap the song cell to recover it.  Deleted songs remain in the trash until iOS reclaims memory.

entries.question: What song formats can I import?
entries.answer: Only files in the Sketch Music format can be imported.

entries.question: How do I import a song?
entries.answer: When sent a sketch music file, tap on the file and select the Sketch Music App from the share sheet. It will appear in the imported song section of the song list.

entries.question: What is the difference between a Demo Song and an Accompaniment?
entries.answer: A Demo Song is an off-copyright song. Accompaniments are helpful starting points to help stimulate new music ideas.

entries.question: Why can’t I edit Demo Songs or Accompaniments?
entries.answer: Only songs in the My Songs folder can be edited. To edit Demo Songs and Accompaniments you have to duplicate them first, which will add them to the My Songs folder.

entries.question: Is there a way to undo my last song change?
entries.answer: Shake your iPhone and select Undo.

entries.question: How do I enter a note on the staff?
entries.answer: Tap a button on the DIBO or a key on the keyboard in the selected staff.

entries.question: What range of notes is covered by the DIBO?
entries.answer: The DIBO supports 25 notes in either staff plus their flats and sharps.

entries.question: How do I add an accidental to a note?
entries.answer: Long-press the associated DIBO button, then select an accidental from the pop-up menu. The keyboard uses a default accidental algorithm and you must return to the DIBO to make adjustments.

entries.question: How do I change note duration?
entries.answer: Tap the minus or plus on either end of the Duration Button.

entries.question: How do I create a Tie?
entries.answer: Tap the Tie Button to create a tie between identical notes (or chords).

entries.question: How do I create a Run?
entries.answer: Runs will automatically be generated between notes of less than a quarter-note duration within a measure.

entries.question: How do I create a Triplet?
entries.answer: Highlight a note with a time value of a quarter note or less, and then tap the triplet button. Each note can then be edited.

entries.question: How do I copy notes?
entries.answer: Long press the note (or chord) and select Copy from the pop-up menu, then long press at any location and tap Paste from the pop-up menu.

entries.question: How do I copy measures?
entries.answer: Long press the measure in the multi-measure view and select Copy from the pop-up menu, then long press on another measure and select Paste from the pop-up menu.

entries.question: How do I view both staves at the same time?
entries.answer: Pull down on the handle above the DIBO to show both measures.

entries.question: How do I add notes above and below the staff?
entries.answer: Tap the small DIBO icons at the top and bottom of the DIBO, or swipe up and down.

entries.question: Is there a way to undo my last notation change?
entries.answer: Shake the iPhone and select undo from the pop up menu.

entries.question: How do I play a song?
entries.answer: Tap the play button in the navigation bar. Long press the icon to select which combination of staves to play.

entries.question: How does Loop mode work?
entries.answer: Loop mode is available in Song View. and is activated by the loop mode button to the left of the play button.  After selecting loop mode, select any note in a measure by tapping on a note (or rest), then press a second note to create a range of notes for looping; this range will be highlighted in blue.   Tapping yet another note in this mode will restart the process of selecting notes.  If only one note is tapped and selected, playback will start from that note and continue by default to the end of the song, unless playback is paused or stopped.

entries.question: Can I play a single measure only?
entries.answer: When editing a measure, the visible measure can be played back by tapping on the play button. To play both staves, pull down the handle on the tray to make both staves visible.

entries.question: How do I access settings?
entries.answer: App Settings are accesible by tapping the wheel icon on the home screen. Song settings are accessible by tapping the settings icon in the toolbar within a song.

entries.question: How do I export audio?
entries.answer: You can create and export M4A Audio files or MIDI files by swiping a song title to the right from the song list or selecting the share button in the multi-measure view. Keep in mind the audio conversion process may take longer than you expect!
